text: hello everyone and welcome to today's

through software Assurance for Windows
Server applications on the AWS Cloud
before we get started I want to mention

business development manager here at

focused on managing the business
relationship between AWS and Microsoft
so with that let's begin hello everyone
and thank you for joining this webinar
our goal today is to share the details
of Microsoft's new license Mobility
Program and how this will benefit aws's
customers so let's just jump right in
and give a bit of the overview of the
program so Microsoft recognizes that
their customers want to leverage their
existing licenses while taking advantage
of all of the benefits of the cloud and
AWS so in July of 2011 Microsoft
announced that they would extend the
rights of their volume license programs
programs such as uh their EAS select
open select all of their volume license
programs that they would extend the
benefits to allow customers to move
their Windows Server applications to
service providers such as
AWS so some of the benefits for
customers and what does this mean for
Microsoft customers and for AWS
customers is that now customers have the
flexibility to run those server
application licenses on premise or on
AWS they have the option to run on AWS
allowing customers to take full
advantage of all the benefits of the AWS
infrastructure platform it also adds
more value to customer software
Assurance program so it's further
benefit for the money that customer that
Microsoft customers have already spent
on their software Assurance programs
through their volume
licensing so without and also another um
big benefit is that without any
additional licensing terms or fees
customers can begin to deploy those
licenses immediately so there are no
other additional license agreements to
sign or terms to um sign up
for so what is license Mobility with
software Assurance um the official
program called license Mobility through
software assurance and we can get into a
little bit of the details and as I
mentioned before customers can now
deploy their server applications in a
shared workload environment provided by
AWS where before customers licensed
workloads had to be deployed physically
on those customer servers running on
premise they can now be deployed on AWS
instances
the primary requirement is those
instances must be covered by active
software assurance and so this became
available in July of
2011 so just a word about Microsoft Vol
volume license programs with software
Assurance so um anyone who's
participating on this call that's a
Microsoft customer I'm sure that you are
very familiar someone in your
organization is very familiar with
Microsoft's volume licensing
programs it really allows customers to
purchase um licenses at a discount and
along with that you can purchase a
maintenance program that provides
customers upgrade rights to servers and
desktop applications so this software
Assurance now includes the right to run
those server applications in a
third-party hosted environment such as
AWS so the eligible software applic
include uh SQL Server standard SQL
Server Enterprise SharePoint exchange
Dynamics link server system center
server there are a few others that are
included that are not listed here uh but
if you go to your Microsoft volume
license agreement and you look at the
product use rights any of the products
that are listed there if they have a
little annotation that says
LM that means that they are are eligible
for this licensed Mobility
[Applause]
Program so it is important to point out
that licensed Mobility does not include
the Windows Server operating system or
any of the business productivity
applications such as Microsoft Office so
whatever workload or server application
mov to AWS will be required to run on an
AWS Windows instance so if you want to
know which osses are supported you can
find that on our web page so you can
bring those server applications over to
run on AWS but you cannot bring your
windows license onto AWS you must run
that on a Windows instance n AWS Windows
instance so just a few more details uh
about the program so how does it it
actually work um Microsoft made this
really pretty simple for customers the
math pretty easy in that one server
application license may be assigned to
one AWS instance no size limit so for
example uh one SharePoint server license
can be assigned to one
AWS
instance so there's also the option if
you have a per proc license if you're
running SQL and you bought a per proc
license the guidance is that you must
have a two proc license and that can be
assigned to one AWS instance no minimum
no maximum so if you have a server-based
license can simply assign that to an AWS
instance if you have or are going to be
buying a proc license you need to
acquire a two proc license and you can
assign that to one AWS instance so
hopefully pretty
straightforward in the case of a server
license um folks may know that you need
to have what's called a cow so a client
application license and again Microsoft
has made this uh pretty easy for
customers in that those
cows can be directly transferred to
AWS so if I had an environment where I
was running SQL standard and I had 50
cows whether they were user Cals or
device Cals those cows will transfer
over to AWS just exactly as if you were
running on premise if I added users or I
added devices then I would need to buy
additional cows but it's exactly
analogous to running uh on
premise another one of the details is
the 90day rule and this is nothing
nothing new to AWS this is part of
Microsoft's standard licensing but it
does require that uh 90day
instances excuse me when you load up an
instance on AWS it must sit in that
region for a minimum of 90 days and a
region can be defined by um any of the
AWS regions within a 4-Hour time
difference so for example Us East and Us
West are considered one region if you
were to put these up in Singapore we'd
have to sit there for 90 days in Ireland
for 90 days in Brazil for 90 days after
that 90 days you can move it to another
location but then it must remain there
again for another 90
days so there is a customer verification
license process
so all customers that are using license
Mobility through software Assurance
Microsoft asks that they complete a
license verification form you can find
that form on the Microsoft site you can
find that form on the
AWS site uh if you go up and you look
for the licens mobility page on AWS
you'll find a link to that form there so
it's pretty simple fill out that form
follow the instructions on the form
forward that to Microsoft the good news
is is that you don't have to wait for
that form to be processed you can begin
to deploy those licenses immediately
while you wait for that verification
form to be
processed so having shared some of the
details of the program uh I thought it
might be interesting to take a look at
some case studies where there are some
real life customers and companies and
organizations that are using licensed
Mobility the first one I'd like to share
with you is recovery.gov so in 2009 the
American Recovery and reinvestment
program was enacted by the federal
government and recovery.gov is a public
website whose goal it is is to provide
taxpayers with a userfriendly tool to
track how and where these recovery funds
are spent so the project started out as
a platform for test and development and
then quickly moved into a production
environment uh the migration took only
22 days and recovery.gov has gone on the
record to say that they expect um this
particular implementation to save them
approximately
$750,000 within the first 12
months this particular solution was
built on AWS um Windows Server instances
it's using SharePoint using SQL and
Forefront all hosted on
AWS so uh the site has been given many
awards including the 2009 merit award
the 2010 Gold atti Award for website
design so it's um won a lot of awards
and is a um great example of running
Windows and Windows Server applications
on
AWS so the second one I'd like to share
with you is
amazon.com so
amazon.com um first of all I will say
Amazon web services we are part of

ideas capture um uh different types of

and

full security view with

and cut their annual costs down by
